markdown:
The **Battle of Wolgast** was an engagement in the [Thirty Years' War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thirty_Years%27_War), fought on 22 August [(O.S.)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Style_and_New_Style_dates)  or 2 September [(N.S.)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Style_and_New_Style_dates)  1628 near [Wolgast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wolgast), [Duchy of Pomerania](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duchy_of_Pomerania), [Germany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germany).<ref group=nb name=julgreg>In the 17th century, the [Julian calendar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julian_calendar) was used in the region, which then was ten days late compared to the [Gregorian calendar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gregorian_calendar):Imperial take-over: 22 August - Julian, 2 September - Gregorian.</ref>
Danish forces of [Christian IV of Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_IV_of_Denmark) had made landfall on [Usedom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usedom) and the adjacent mainland, and expelled the [imperial occupation forces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capitulation_of_Franzburg). An [Imperial army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Army_%28Holy_Roman_Empire%29) commanded by [Albrecht von Wallenstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albrecht_von_Wallenstein) left [besieged Stralsund](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Stralsund_%281628%29) to confront Christian IV. Ultimately, the Danish forces were defeated. Christian IV and a faction of his landing force were able to escape by ship.

#### Prelude
 [Christian IV of Denmark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_IV_of_Denmark) had started the Danish intervention in the [Thirty Years' War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thirty_Years%27_War) by invading the [Holy Roman Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holy_Roman_Empire) in 1625. Initially successful, he suffered setbacks when his armies were defeated in the battles of [Dessau Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Dessau_Bridge) and [Lutter am Barenberge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Lutter) ... [continue reading](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Wolgast)
name: Battle of Wolgast
